page.title: 15Kenn Village (page 1)
page.content: Along the main{Clevedon Road}to{ {Yatton}can be found the quiet and interesting village of{Kenn.}Most of its population of{280}however live in largely detatched, stone houses along{ {Kenn Street.}Here too is the church of {St.John}- open daily from{9 a.m.}to {6 p.m.}The village is proud of its lack of vandalism. The tiny church, with Norman origins, is carpeted throughout and beautifully lit by stained glass windows. The oldest grave found was dated {1711}and the most recent,{1984. Alongside is the old school. Built in {1851}and once attended by village children, it was later sold by the church and used for various businesses and is now being renovated as a 3 bedroomed bungalow offered at{Â£54,000. An old chapel has also been converted and is opposite the old school house.
